node.title: Singapore to bill unvaccinated COVID-19 patients as cases surge across island
node.description: Singapore's Ministry of Health announces that from December 8, all COVID-19 patients who are eligible for vaccination but choose not to do so will need to cover their own medical expenses.
node.content:
["Unvaccinated patients in Singapore will have to pay their own medical bills from next month as the island nation tries to come\u00a0to grips with a worrying COVID-19 caseload.", "In the past 24 hours, Singapore reported\u00a014 deaths from coronavirus and\u00a02,470 new cases.", "Singapore's\u00a0Ministry of Health (MOH) says the government has been paying full coronavirus medical costs of all Singaporeans, permanent residents and long-term pass holders since the pandemic began.", "This does not include\u00a0those residents who test positive after returning from overseas travel.", "But from\u00a0December 8, all\u00a0COVID-19\u00a0patients in Singapore who are eligible for vaccination but\u00a0choose\u00a0not to do so will need to cover their own medical expenses.", "Those\u00a0patients who have received only one jab will not be charged by doctors and hospitals for coronavirus treatment until December 31 to allow them to complete their\u00a0vaccination.", "", "
More than 85 per cent of Singaporeans have received two doses of a COVID-19 vaccine.(Reuters: Edgar Su)
", "In explaining its decision, the MOH said\u00a0unvaccinated people disproportionately contribute to the strain on Singapore's health care system because\u00a0they represent the majority of patients who need intensive care for COVID-19.", "Children who are below 12 and those who are medically unable to receive vaccines will still have their bills covered\u00a0by Singapore authorities.", "\u00a0\"[The government has paid for medical expenses] to avoid financial considerations adding to public uncertainty and concern when COVID-19\u00a0was an emergent and unfamiliar disease,\" the MOH said in a statement.", "\"For the majority who are vaccinated, this special approach for COVID-19 bills will continue until the COVID-19 situation is more stable.\"", "Singapore is one of the world's most inoculated countries with more than 85 per cent of the population having received two doses of a coronavirus vaccine, with 18 per cent given booster shots.", "Among its elderly population,\u00a094 per cent of people between the ages of\u00a060 to 69, and 90 per cent of those aged 70 and older have been double dosed.", "Of the new COVID-19 cases,\u00a02,307 were reported in the community with\u00a0156 infections in migrant worker dormitories\u00a0and seven imported cases.", "Meanwhile,\u00a0Singapore and Malaysia will allow quarantine-free travel between both countries for individuals vaccinated against COVID-19 later this month, according to a joint statement released on Monday.", "The neighbours will launch a\u00a0vaccinated travel lane between Changi Airport and Kuala Lumpur International Airport from November 29, the statement said.", "", "
Outbreak: How Australia lost control of the Delta variant
"]
